reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best budget hotel in Zermatt. The location is good. Little far from train station but the owner arranged for pickup and drop facility without any additional cost. The entire hotel is of wood and stones. The rooms are awesome. The hotel has a geothermal heating system. The staff Murielle was very kind and helping. The breakfast was very good. Highly recommended in Zermatt!!!
reviews.title: Perfect!!! Ten Stars!!!

reviews.text: Hotel Phoenix in Zermatt was so nice! The staff was pleasant. The lounge area was very cosy with a roaring fireplace, overstuffed couches and a lovely bar. My friend and I enjoyed the free snacks with a lovely glass of wine. The room was very rustic feeling and had a private balcony as well. The beds were very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was very nice in a lovely, bright room with large windows to see the surrounding winter chalet scene. My overall experience was amazing. I can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Cozy & Perfect!

reviews.text: Stayed here for an early weekend and I was positively surprised by the charm of this very well kept and great designed hotel. The hotel is just a short walk from the train station but you might wanna order a "taxi" to get there when arriving with bags and skis...
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: The hotel is very clean has an outstanding designs mixing old and new and its staff is well educated, nice and helpful.. The rooms are very well designed and offers always fresh water and spectacular views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked from the train station(a bit up hill),to find a wonderful modern stone and glass mid-sized hotel a little off the beaten tourist path( a plus as far as we were concerned,and it is only two "blocks" away from public transport ). Our room(505) had a a great view of the Matterhorn(I had requested such when I made our reservation), and was clean and spacious. I only hope other guests take good care of the beautiful light coloured wood and white walls as they seem rather vulnerable. The staff at the recption desk was friendly, and had good advice about activities and public transportation. Breakfast was very good. It really was nice to be in an open airy,"green" hotel for a change. reviews.title: Fabulous hotel in a town with very high standards.
Nice Hotel, great room.
reviews.text: The hotel is not far from the train but if you are carrying bags, it helps to take one of the electric taxis. After that, everything is only a walk away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are immaculate and beautifully appointed. We love the radiant heated floors. Beds, bathroom and linens are great. Lots of electrical outlets (a necessity these days). Wifi in the lobby but only wired internet in the rooms. We travel with a portable wifi router which worked fine. The lobby/lobby bar is an inviting place to wind down after an day outdoors. Every recommendation that at the front desk made was spot on (thanks Muriel and Jessica!). The entire staff was warm, friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful view of The Matterhorn

reviews.text: Zermatt is a magical town. So much to do. Great atmosphere. Skiing, hiking, shopping, dining and exploring old town. The Hotel Phoenix was a great choice from which to call home base.
reviews.title: Great stay in zermatt!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel. Great room and great view. Close to centre of town. Free welcome drink was a nice touch and breakfast was included.
reviews.title: Perfect Mountain lodge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Phoenix Hotel in July with my husband and our families. One of the coziest and most beautiful hotels in Zermatt and in Switzerland. The hotel beautifully combines the luxury of modern living with the warmth and charm of characteristic rustic Swiss-chalets- the rooms and bathrooms were large, open and bright, and the views of the Matterhorn from our balconies were gorgeous. Josef, the owner, and the rest of the staff were incredibly nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed a Hotel Phoenix on our honeymoon and had the best 2 night stay. The staff were so lovely, location was excellent, room was gorgeous and outstanding view of theMatterhorn. The breakfast was fantastic and the bar is a lovely place to relax or a drink before dinner in te town. We would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to visiting again!
reviews.title: Unbelievable stay in Zermatt!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two nights at the Hotel Phoenix in Zermatt. In a word, the hotel was excellent. It was also the best rate we got in staying in Switzerland which came as a supprise considering it is Zermatt. It is a ten minute hike from the train station but a little hard to find. The beds were the best we slept in while in country and the rooms were clean, modern and really wonderful. Bathrooms were also wonderful. We had a balcony that overlooked the street and would have liked to have had one that faced the Matterhorn but we still enjoyed the tranquility of the neighborhood. Breakfast was also also very good. Wonderful and helpful staff too. My wife injured her knee while hiking and they were helpful in getting her some ice to put on it. In a word, this hotel definately deserves all the great reviews it has received. It was five star in delivering on our expectations for a good hotel at a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Best accomodations we had in Switzerland

The staff were really friendly and the hotel was nice and cosy especially with a rustic feel but yet mordern. I would definately recommnd this hotel
